Docs.summary: The resource in the target data model that the variable is bound to, or .
Docs.value: The resource in the target data model that the variable is bound to, or if the variable is not bound in this result.
Docs.remarks: A variable may be unbound only if it was used exclusively in optional statements.

MemberSignature.Value: public static SemWeb.Statement Substitute (SemWeb.Query.VariableBinding[] variables, SemWeb.Statement template);

Docs.param: The statement containing variables to replace.
Docs.summary: Replaces the variables in the statement with their bound values.
Docs.returns: The statement with variables replaced by target values.
Docs.remarks: Variables may be unbound, in which case their values are . The returned statement may therefore have a subject, predicate, object, or meta.

Docs.summary: The name of the variable as used in the query, or if it had no name.
Docs.value: The name of the variable as used in the query, or if it had no name.

MemberSignature.Value: public VariableBinding (SemWeb.BNode variable, string name, SemWeb.Resource target);

Docs.param: The value bound to the variable, or .

Docs.summary: A binding between a query variable and a resource in the target data model.
